import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";
import RequestSchema from "@theme/RequestSchema";
import StatusCodes from "@theme/StatusCodes";
import OperationTabs from "@theme/OperationTabs";
import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";
import Heading from "@theme/Heading";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Profiles Default Search Fields"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/search/advanced/metadata/fields/profiles/default"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Returns the fields that can be used in the advanced search for profiles with the
'customQuery' query parameter. The names of the fields are the ones that you will
actually use in the 'customQuery' parameter. The rest of the properties are only
useful if you want to build your own UI to allow your users to build the 'customQuery'
using a user-friendly interface.

Note that the schema of the returned object is based on the [React Query Builder](https://react-querybuilder.js.org/).
You can read its documentation [here](https://react-querybuilder.js.org/docs/intro).

**Important**: This feature is only available for paying API keys.


<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"X-API-KEY","in":"header","required":true,"description":"Your Talent Protocol API Key","schema":{"type":"string"}},{"name":"Authorization","in":"header","description":"Optional: The JWT to identify a calling User","schema":{"type":"string"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

<StatusCodes
  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}
  responses={{"200":{"description":"get fields to use with 'customQuery' in advanced search for profiles","content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"name":{"type":"string","description":"The name of the field. This is what you will use in the 'customQuery'"},"label":{"type":"string","description":"UI helper: The label of the field. This is what you will show to the user in the UI."},"inputType":{"type":"string","description":"UI helper: One of 'text', 'number', 'datetime-local'.","enum":["text","number","datetime-local"]},"valueEditorType":{"type":"string","description":"UI helper: One of 'checkbox', 'select', 'multi-select', 'text'.","enum":["checkbox","select","multi-select","text"]},"values":{"type":"array","description":"UI helper: The set of values a field can take values from.","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"name":{"type":"string","description":"The name of the value. This is what will actually be provided as input value."},"label":{"type":"string","description":"The label of the value"}}}}}}}}}}}}
>
  
</StatusCodes>
